posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I have tried to make an evil Speed Caster based on the Speed Caster by WhiZard:
The point of the build is that the Monk speed feat overrides the speedcap of +50% and let you stack speed from different spells (mass haste, expeditious retreat) so you can move with an insane speed. It takes 3 levels of monk to get the feat. (See the speed calculations in WhiZard's post)
WhiZard also uses one level of Paladin for the Divine grace feat to get a save boost from the high charisma. In my build I use 2 levels of BG for the Dark blessing feat with the same effect.

An important question is when to take the monk and BG levels. If you spread them out evenly, you will have skill dumps for optimum skill investment. If you build for lvl 40, it is best to take those classes late for the same reason.
If you level up your character in a normal way, playing the levels, you may want to get Monk 3 early so you can zoom around at high speed during leveling. The same goes for the save boost from BG. But then again if you multiclass a sorcerer too early you will lack the spellpower necessary for carefree levelling.
This character will not stand and fight like a tank in full armor with expertise on, it is supposed to RUN, so I have dropped Discipline and left Tumble at 15, just enough to avoid AOOs when running around.

I welcome feedback.

Well, I would personally drop Quicken, as I see no spell that is useful 4 levels higher. I'd take Craft Wand instead.

Other than that, you get exactly where you want to get. Cool build, Mick!
